item.title: Ticket #1413 (is_* functions still return true on is_404() pages) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
If you use is_single(), is_day(), is_month(), is_year() etc in your theme to show/hide things conditionally, the don't work as they should for 404 requests. So if ​http://site.com/2004/04/02/bad-title does not exist, is_404() will be true, but so will is_single()

If a page is 404, it can't be anything else. Even if it looks like it is formatted like a permalink page, it's not a single page. It's a 404, period. The logic should be changed so that if is_404() is true, every other "is" is false.

item.title: Ticket #1412 (Object unserialization using get_option fails) created
item.dc:creator: EricAnderson
item.description:
Basically, the object is serialized fine, however the code that retreives all the options, unserializes the object as soon as its retrieved from the DB, but since that code happens long before the plugin code is loaded, the class definition is non existant.

The 'correct' way to handle this, would be to not unserialize until the coder calls get_option, in this case, the class definition would be loaded and there would be more problems.

I originally laid out this problem here: ​http://ericanderson.us/blog/2005-03-08/hacking-wordpresss-get_option-object-unserialization/

item.title: Ticket #1411 (Edit Page button should be called Save Page) created
item.dc:creator: threefour
item.description: It's odd that the button that allows you the SAVE your page on the page editing screen is called "Edit Page >>" and not "Save Page". On the post editing screen, the option there is to SAVE.
